title: How to Connect an Xbox to an iPhone

steps.headline: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.description: It's the grey gear icon on the Home Screen.

steps.headline: Tap Bluetooth.
steps.description: This option is near the top of the Settings page.

steps.headline: Slide the Bluetooth switch right to the "On" position.
steps.description: It will turn green, signifying that your iPhone can now cast its screen to other devices.

steps.headline: Turn on your Xbox One and TV.
steps.description: To turn on your Xbox One, you can either press the X button on the front of the console, or you can hold down the X button in the middle of a connected controller.

steps.headline: Open an app that supports screencasting.
steps.description: You'll do this on both your iPhone and your Xbox One. For example, for Netflix you would select the Xbox One's Netflix app in addition to opening the Netflix app on your iPhone and signing in. YouTube, Netflix, and Hulu all support screencasting.

steps.headline: Tap the screencast icon.
steps.description: It's the rectangle with ripples in its bottom left corner. While the screencast icon will usually be at the top of your iPhone's screen, its location may vary based on the apps you're using.

steps.headline: Tap XboxOne.
steps.description: This option will usually be next to text that says something like "Connect To Device." Once your phone is connected to your Xbox, you can play Netflix episodes or browse YouTube directly from your phone and have it play on your TV. You may need to confirm that you want to play your selected app media on the Xbox One again right before playing it by tapping Xbox One.

steps.headline: Open the App Store.
steps.description: It's the white "A" on a light blue background. If you already have the Xbox app, skip to the next part.

steps.headline: Tap Search.
steps.description: This option is at the bottom of the screen.

steps.headline: Tap the search bar.
steps.description: It's at the top of the screen.

steps.headline: Tap Search.
steps.description: It's the blue button on the keyboard.

steps.headline: Tap GET at the top of the page.
steps.description: It's to the right of the "Xbox" app here. The Xbox app is created by the Microsoft Corporation.

steps.headline: Tap INSTALL.
steps.description: It's in the same spot as GET was.

steps.headline: Enter your Apple ID password.
steps.description: Once you do so, your app will begin downloading. You can also use Touch ID if you have it enabled.

steps.headline: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.description: It's the grey gear icon on the Home Screen.

steps.headline: Tap Bluetooth.
steps.description: This option is near the top of the Settings page.

steps.headline: Slide the Bluetooth switch right to the "On" position.
steps.description: It will turn green, signifying that your iPhone can now connect to your Xbox One.

steps.headline: Turn on your Xbox One and TV.
steps.description: To turn on your Xbox One, you can either press the X button on the front of the console, or you can hold down the X button in the middle of a connected controller.

steps.headline: Open your iPhone's Xbox app.
steps.description: It's green with a white X on it.

steps.headline: Tap Sign In.
steps.description: It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.headline: Type in your Xbox Live email address.
steps.description: You'll do this in the field below the "Sign In" text.

steps.headline: Tap Next.
steps.description: This button is below the email address entry field.

steps.headline: Tap Sign In.
steps.description: It's below the password entry field.

steps.headline: Tap Let's Play.
steps.description: If you signed in correctly, this option is at the bottom of the screen.

steps.headline: Tap ☰.
steps.description: It's in the top left corner of the screen.

steps.headline: Tap Connection.
steps.description: This option is about halfway down the drop-down menu here. Doing so will cause your iPhone to search for an Xbox to connect to.

steps.headline: Tap Connect to Your Xbox One.
steps.description: You should see this option below the "Connection" heading on this page.

steps.headline: Tap your Xbox One's name.
steps.description: If you haven't renamed your Xbox One, this will just say "XboxOne".

steps.headline: Tap Connect.
steps.description: Now that your Xbox and iPhone are connected through the Xbox app, you can use your iPhone as a remote control to navigate through your Xbox's Home screen.

text: Using App Screencasting Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey gear icon on the Home Screen. Tap Bluetooth. This option is near the top of the Settings page. Slide the Bluetooth switch right to the "On" position. It will turn green, signifying that your iPhone can now cast its screen to other devices. Turn on your Xbox One and TV. To turn on your Xbox One, you can either press the X button on the front of the console, or you can hold down the X button in the middle of a connected controller. Open an app that supports screencasting. You'll do this on both your iPhone and your Xbox One. For example, for Netflix you would select the Xbox One's Netflix app in addition to opening the Netflix app on your iPhone and signing in. YouTube, Netflix, and Hulu all support screencasting. Tap the screencast icon. It's the rectangle with ripples in its bottom left corner. While the screencast icon will usually be at the top of your iPhone's screen, its location may vary based on the apps you're using. Tap XboxOne. This option will usually be next to text that says something like "Connect To Device." Once your phone is connected to your Xbox, you can play Netflix episodes or browse YouTube directly from your phone and have it play on your TV. You may need to confirm that you want to play your selected app media on the Xbox One again right before playing it by tapping Xbox One. Downloading the Xbox App Open the App Store. It's the white "A" on a light blue background. If you already have the Xbox app, skip to the next part. Tap Search. This option is at the bottom of the screen. Tap the search bar. It's at the top of the screen. Type "Xbox" into the search bar.  Tap Search. It's the blue button on the keyboard. Tap GET at the top of the page. It's to the right of the "Xbox" app here. The Xbox app is created by the Microsoft Corporation. Tap INSTALL. It's in the same spot as GET was. Enter your Apple ID password. Once you do so, your app will begin downloading. You can also use Touch ID if you have it enabled. Using the Xbox App Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the grey gear icon on the Home Screen. Tap Bluetooth. This option is near the top of the Settings page. Slide the Bluetooth switch right to the "On" position. It will turn green, signifying that your iPhone can now connect to your Xbox One. Turn on your Xbox One and TV. To turn on your Xbox One, you can either press the X button on the front of the console, or you can hold down the X button in the middle of a connected controller. Open your iPhone's Xbox app. It's green with a white X on it. Tap Sign In. It's at the bottom of the screen. Type in your Xbox Live email address. You'll do this in the field below the "Sign In" text. Tap Next. This button is below the email address entry field. Type in your password.  Tap Sign In. It's below the password entry field. Tap Let's Play. If you signed in correctly, this option is at the bottom of the screen. Tap ☰. It's in the top left corner of the screen. Tap Connection. This option is about halfway down the drop-down menu here. Doing so will cause your iPhone to search for an Xbox to connect to. Tap Connect to Your Xbox One. You should see this option below the "Connection" heading on this page. Tap your Xbox One's name. If you haven't renamed your Xbox One, this will just say "XboxOne". Tap Connect. Now that your Xbox and iPhone are connected through the Xbox app, you can use your iPhone as a remote control to navigate through your Xbox's Home screen.
